definition: lit. to put a fire under a pile of firewood (idiom)/fig. hidden danger/imminent danger
to lay in place/to put/to place a coffin in a temporary location pending burial
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
to deceive/there is none/old variant of 網|网[wang3]
the meaning of sth/an explanation of the meaning of words or phrases/definition/an interpretation (of doctrine)/religious doctrine
lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty/to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
lit. to carry firewood to put out a fire (idiom); fig. to make a problem worse by inappropriate action
(literary) (final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 呢[ne5] or 啊[a1])
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/short attention span
lit. to bend the chimney and remove the firewood (to prevent fire) (idiom)/fig. to take preventive measures
